TITLE: Over-the-counter hearing aids will bring relief, but with some confusion
SUMMARY: A new FDA rule is being praised for making hearing aids more affordable. But Medicare doesn't cover them, and neither do most insurance policies.

TITLE: 'Dopesick' author turns her attention to the citizen volunteers combatting addiction
SUMMARY: Author Beth Macy and harm reduction specialist Michelle Mathis talk about grassroots and community efforts to address the opioid crisis. Macy's latest book is <em>Raising Lazarus.

TITLE: Germany's Rhine is at one of its lowest levels. That's trouble for the top EU economy
SUMMARY: A hot, dry summer has meant the water level on the Rhine River, Western Europe's most important waterway, is at a record low, making it too shallow for many ships to pass.

TITLE: Suspended Florida prosecutor sues Gov. Ron DeSantis to get his job back
SUMMARY: Gov. DeSantis removed State Attorney Andrew Warren from office because Warren pledged not to prosecute people for violating abortion restrictions. Warren said he was ousted for political reasons.

TITLE: After criticism over COVID, the CDC chief plans to make the agency more nimble
SUMMARY: The proposed changes at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention come amid ongoing criticism of the agency's response to COVID-19, monkeypox and other public health threats.

TITLE: Pence says he'd consider testifying to House January 6 committee
SUMMARY: During an event in New Hampshire Wednesday morning, former Vice President Pence said he'd consider an invitation from the House January 6 committee to testify.

TITLE: What is a waterspout? Here's how the spectacular one in Florida formed
SUMMARY: A massive waterspout off the coast of Destin, Fla., Tuesday captured the attention of many. Several conditions are necessary to create one of these tornado-like phenomena.

TITLE: A new student filmmaking grant will focus on reproductive rights
SUMMARY: The Annenberg Inclusion Initiative announced Wednesday that it has created the program in response to the overturning of <em>Roe v. Wade

TITLE: The spending bill will cut emissions, but marginalized groups feel they were sold out
SUMMARY: The Inflation Reduction Act is the biggest ever investment to tackle climate change. But there are signs that it could reinforce existing environmental inequalities.

TITLE: After decades, author Jamil Jan Kochai reunites with the teacher who changed his life
SUMMARY: The writer searched for more than a decade for Susan Lung, who taught him to read and write English when he was a 7-year-old in 1999. On Saturday, she surprised him at one of his book readings.

TITLE: Murkowski and her Trump-backed challenger advance in Alaska Senate race
SUMMARY: Under a voter-approved elections process being used for the first time in Alaska elections this year, party primaries have been scrapped and ranked choice voting is being used in general elections.

TITLE: Judge rejects plea deal in submarine secrets case, saying sentences were too light
SUMMARY: A Maryland couple had been charged in an alleged plot to sell secrets about U.S. nuclear-powered warships by hiding information in objects such as a chewing gum wrapper and a peanut butter sandwich.

TITLE: A new label revives forgotten female composers' music
SUMMARY: The new record label La Boîte à Pépites is dedicated to raising the profile of female composers whose works have been neglected.

TITLE: How Georgia reduced heat-related high school football deaths
SUMMARY: Starting practice at the hottest time of year, football players face dangers from the heat. Georgia high school heat rules have turned the state into a national model.

TITLE: For the first time in 20 years, teachers can deduct more for school supplies
SUMMARY: Eligible educators include K-12 teachers, principals, teachers' aides or counselors who spend more than 900 hours at the school during the academic year.
